Value.label: Wake up 10 minutes on Power On
Value.Help: Enable/Disable waking up for 10 minutes when re-power on (battery mode) the MultiSensor

Value.label: On time
Value.Help: Duration that the motion sensor must observe no motion before it will return to the no-motion state. If value greater than 255, effective value is rounded up to the nearest minute (255 -> 255 seconds, 256 -> 300 seconds)

Value.label: Enable Motion Sensor
Value.Help: Enable Motion Sensor, (1 minimum, 5 maximum sensitivity level)

Value.label: Command Options
Value.Help: Which commands to send when PIR motion sensor triggered OZW Ideal Value is Binary Sensor Report

Value.label: Awake timeout
Value.Help: Set the timeout of awake after the Wake Up CC is sent out. Available rang: 8 to 255 seconds.

Value.label: Current power mode
Value.Help: Report the current power mode and the product state for battery power mode

Item.label: USB power, sleeping mode after re-power on
USB power, keep awake for 10 minutes after re-power on
Battery power, sleeping mode after re-power on
Battery power, keep awake for 10 minutes after re-power on

Value.label: Low Battery
Value.Help: Configure low battery value Value=10 to 50.

Value.label: Report Only On Thresholds
Value.Help: Enable/disable the selective reporting only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage set in the threshold settings. This is used to reduce network traffic.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is Fahrenheit for US version, Celsius for EU/AU version. 2. The value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the threshold value = 2.0 C (EU/AU) or 2.0 F (US). When the temperature has changed by 2.0 (of the appropriate unit), a temperature report will be sent.

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in humidity will trigger a report.

Value.label: Luminance Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Battery Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in battery will trigger a report.

Value.label: UV Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in ultraviolet to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Low Temp Alarm
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send the alarm report of low temperature(Less than 15 Degress C)

Value.label: Enable/disable to send a report on Threshold
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send a report when the measurement is more than the upper limit value or less than the lower limit value. Bit mask = 0, disable. Bit mask = 1, enable. Bit 0 = temperature. Bit 1 = humidity. Bit 2 = luminance. Bit 3 = ultraviolet. The above bit masks are used to enable/disable to send out a report when the measurement is less than the lower limit value. The below bit masks are used to enable/disable to send out a report when the measurement is more than the upper limit value. Bit 4 = temperature. Bit 5 = humidity. Bit 6 = luminance. Bit 7 = ultraviolet. Note: If USB power, the Sensor will check the limit every 10 seconds. If battery power, the Sensor will check the limit when it is waken up.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. High byte is the upper limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 1. When unit is Celsius. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 100.0 C (0xFE70 to 0x03E8). E.g. The default upper limit of EU/AU version is 28.0 C (0x0118), when the measurement is more than 28.0C, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report. 2. When unit is Fahrenheit. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 212.0 F (0xFE70 to 0x0848). E.g. The default upper limit of US version is 82.4F (0X0338), when the measurement is more than 82.4F, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. High byte is the lower limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 1. When unit is Celsius. Lower limit range: -40.0 to 100.0 C (0xFE70 to 0x03E8). E.g. The default lower limit of EU/AU version is 0 C (0x0000), when the measurement is less than 0C, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report. 2. When unit is Fahrenheit. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 212.0 F (0xFE70 to 0x0848). E.g. The default lower limit of US version is 32.0F (0x0140), when the measurement is less than 32.0F, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 0 to 100%. E.g. The default upper limit is 60%, when the measurement is more than 60%, it will be triggered to send out a humidity sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 0 to 100%. E.g. The default lower limit is 50%, when the measurement is less than 50%, it will be triggered to send out a humidity sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 0 to 30000 Lux. E.g. The default upper limit is 1000Lux, when the measurement is more than 1000Lux, it will be triggered to send out a Lighting sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 0 to 30000 Lux. E.g. The default lower limit is 100Lux, when the measurement is less than 100Lux, it will be triggered to send out a Lighting sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 1 to 11. E.g. The default upper limit is 8, when the measurement is more than 8, it will be triggered to send out a ultraviolet sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 1 to 11. E.g. The default lower limit is 4, when the measurement is less than 8, it will be triggered to send out a ultraviolet sensor report.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that, the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that, the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. High byte is the recover limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 4. Recover limit range: 1.0 to 25.5 C/ F (0x0101 to 0xFF01 or 0x0102 to 0xFF02). E.g. The default recover limit value is 2.0 C/F (0x1401/0x1402), when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 2), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 2), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal(Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Recover limit range: 1 to 50% (0x01 to 0x32). E.g. The default recover limit value is 5%, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 5), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 5), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Unit = 10*Recover limit (Lux) 4. Recover limit range: 10 to 2550Lux (0x01 to 0xFF). E.g. The default recover limit value is 100 Lux, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 100), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 100), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of Ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal(Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Recover limit range: 1 to 50% (0x01 to 0x32). E.g. The default recover limit value is 5%, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 5), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 5), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Get the out-of-limit state of the Sensors
Value.Help: Get the out-of-limit state of the Sensors. Bit mask = 0, within the limit. Bit mask = 1, out of the limit. Bit 0 = temperature. Bit 1 = humidity. Bit 2 = luminance. Bit 3 = ultraviolet. The above bit masks are used to indicate whether the current measurements of the Sensors are out of the lower limit. The below bit masks are used to indicate whether the current measurements of the Sensors are out of the upper limit. Bit 4 = temperature. Bit 5 = humidity. Bit 6 = luminance. Bit 7 = ultraviolet.

Value.label: Temperature scale
Value.Help: Default value: Celsius for EU/AU version, Fahrenheit for US version.

Value.label: LED blinking report
Value.Help: Enable/disable the LED blinking for motion, wakeup, and sensor report.

Item.label: Disable LED blinking only when the PIR is triggered
Completely disable LED for motion, wakeup, and sensor report

Value.label: Reset Params 101-103 to Default
Value.Help: Reset The Reporting Group Configuration (101 to 103) to default

Value.label: Group 1 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 1. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Group 2 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 2. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Group 3 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 3. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Reset Params 111-113 to Default
Value.Help: Reset The Reporting Group Interval Configuration (111 to 113) to default

Value.label: Group 1 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 1. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Group 2 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 2. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Group 3 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 3. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Temperature Calibration
Value.Help: Temperature calibration (the available value range is [-128,127] or [-12.8C,12.7C]). Note: 1. High byte is the calibration value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius,0x02=Fahrenheit) 2. The calibration value (high byte) contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20 (0x1401), the calibration value is 2.0C (EU/AU version) or if the value is set to 20 (0x1402), the calibration value is 2.0F (US version) 3. The calibration value (high byte) = standard value - measure value. E.g. If measure value =25.3C and the standard value = 23.2C, so the calibration value= 23.2C - 25.3C= -2.1C (0xEB). If the measure value =30.1C and the standard value = 33.2C, so the calibration value= 33.2C - 30.1C=3.1C (0x1F). Default value: 1 for EU/AU version, 2 for US version.

Value.label: Humidity Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value - measure value. (the available value range is [-50, 50]). If measure value =80RH and the standard value = 75RH, so the calibration value= 75RH-80RH = -5RH (0xFB). If the measure value =85RH and the standard value = 90RH, so the calibration value= 90RH-85RH = 5RH (0x05).

Value.label: Luminance Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value - measure value. (the available value range is [-1000, 1000]). If measure value =800Lux and the standard value = 750Lux, so the calibration value= 750-800 = -50 (0xFFCE). If the measure value =850Lux and the standard value = 900Lux, so the calibration value= 900-850 = 50 (0x0032).

Value.label: Ultraviolet Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value measure value. (the available value range is [-10, 10]). If measure value =9 and the standard value = 8, so the calibration value= 8-9 = -1 (0xFE). If the measure value =7 and the standard value = 9, so the calibration value= 9-7 = 2 (0x02).

Value.label: Enable/disable Lock Configuration
Value.Help: Enable/disable Lock Configuration

Value.label: Reset To Factory Defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults

Item.label: Reset to factory default setting and removed from the z-wave network

Value.label: Over heat protection
Value.Help: Output load will be closed after 30 seconds if the temperature inside the product exceeds 100C.

Value.label: Status re-power on
Value.Help: Configure the output load status after re-power on

Item.label: The last status before the power outage

Value.label: WallSwipe IR sensor
Value.Help: Enable/disable the IR sensor of WallSwipe. (LSB) Value 1. Value 1 = 0, disable the IR Sensor. Value 1 = 1, enable the IR Sensor. Value 2 = 0, Wave Option 1 is selected. Value 2 = 1, Wave Option 2 is selected. Value 3 = 0, disable the scene control functionality for Left/Right wave. Value 3 = 1, enable the scene control functionality for Left/Right wave Value 4 = 0, disable the scene control functionality for all wave actions. Value 4 = 1, enable the scene control functionality for all wave actions.

Value.label: WallSwipe button color
Value.Help: Set the button color of WallSwipe. Value 1= Level 1. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Up gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is UP. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Down gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is Down. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Left gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is Left. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Right gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is Right. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe Night light
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when it is in Night light state. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe sensitivity
Value.Help: Set the sensitivity of WallSwipe.

Value.label: Notification report association group 1
Value.Help: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association group 1 when the state of output load is changed

Item.label: Hail CC when using the external switch to switch the loads

Value.label: Notification report using the external switch 1
Value.Help: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association group 3 when using the external switch 1 to switch the loads

Value.label: Notification report using the external switch 2
Value.Help: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association group 4 when using the external switch 2 to switch the loads

Value.label: LED status
Value.Help: Configure the state of LED when it is in 3 modes below

Item.label: The LED will follow the status
LED will follow the status (on/off) of its load but the LED will turn off after 5 seconds

Value.label: Time set for Night light mode
Value.Help: Value1: Hour of ON. Value2: Minute of ON. Value3: Hour of OFF. Value4: Minute of OFF. E.g. The default setting is the Night light mode is enabled at 12: 00 and disabled at 8:00 0x12000800.

Value.label: Set the ON time of output load
Value.Help: Value1: 0= Disable / 1= Enable. Value2: Weekday (Bit 0-6 means Monday to Sunday). Value3: Hour of turning OFF. Value4: Minute of turning OFF E.g. The default setting 0x007F1200

Value.label: Set the OFF time of output load
Value.Help: Value1: 0= Disable / 1= Enable. Value2: Weekday (Bit 0-6 means Monday to Sunday). Value3: Hour of turning OFF. Value4: Minute of turning OFF E.g. The default setting 0x001707F00

Value.label: Set the external S1 mode
Value.Help: When the switch mode of S1 is determined or identified or configured, this mode value will not be reset after exclusion

Value.label: Set the external S2 mode
Value.Help: When the switch mode of S2 is determined or identified or configured, this mode value will not be reset after exclusion

Value.label: Set the control destination of the external switch

Item.label: Control other nodes in the same network
Control itself and other nodes in the same network

Value.label: WallSwipe
Value.Help: Get the state of touch panel port

Value.label: S1/S2 when the Switch mode is 3-way switch
Value.Help: Set the working way for S1/S2 when the Switch mode is 3-way switch mode.

Item.label: S1 and S2 is a toggle switch
S1 and S2 are an On/Off switch

Value.label: Function of S1/S2
Value.Help: Set the function of S1/S2. Bit 0 = 0, the function of sending NIF is disabled. Bit 0 = 1, the function of sending NIF is enabled. Bit 1 = 0, the function of entering RF power level test mode is disabled. Bit 1 = 1, the function of entering RF power level test mode is enabled. Bit 2 = 0, the function of factory reset is disabled. Bit 2 = 1, the function of factory reset is enabled. Bit 3 to Bit 6 are reserved. Bit 7 = 0, the setting for Bit 0 to Bit 2 are ineffective. Bit 7 = 1, the setting for Bit 0 to Bit 2 are effective.

Value.label: Configuration factory reset function
Value.Help: Enable/disable the factory reset function of Action Button, external switches or WallSwipe.

Value.label: Reset To Factory Defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults

Item.label: Reset to factory default setting and removed from the z-wave network

Value.label: Over heat protection
Value.Help: Output load will be closed after 30 seconds if the temperature inside the product exceeds 100C.

Value.label: Status re-power on
Value.Help: Configure the output load status after re-power on

Item.label: The last status before the power outage

Value.label: WallSwipe IR sensor
Value.Help: Enable/disable the IR sensor of WallSwipe. (LSB) Value 1. Value 1 = 0, disable the IR Sensor. Value 1 = 1, enable the IR Sensor. Value 2 = 0, Wave Option 1 is selected. Value 2 = 1, Wave Option 2 is selected. Value 3 = 0, disable the scene control functionality for Left/Right wave. Value 3 = 1, enable the scene control functionality for Left/Right wave Value 4 = 0, disable the scene control functionality for all wave actions. Value 4 = 1, enable the scene control functionality for all wave actions.

Value.label: WallSwipe button color
Value.Help: Set the button color of WallSwipe. Value 1= Level 1. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Up gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is UP. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Down gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is Down. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Left gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is Left. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe LED Right gesture action
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when the gesture action is Right. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe Night light
Value.Help: Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe when it is in Night light state. Value 1= Reserved. Value 2= the color value of Red. Value 3= the color value of Green. Value 4= the color value of Blue.

Value.label: WallSwipe sensitivity
Value.Help: Set the sensitivity of WallSwipe.

Value.label: Notification report association group 1
Value.Help: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association group 1 when the state of output load is changed. Note: When just only one channel load state is changed, the report message Hail CC or Basic Report CC would be Multi Channel encapsulated.

Item.label: Hail CC when using the external switch to switch the loads

Value.label: Notification report using the external switch 1
Value.Help: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association group 3 when using the external switch 1 to switch the loads

Value.label: Notification report using the external switch 2
Value.Help: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association group 4 when using the external switch 2 to switch the loads

Value.label: LED status
Value.Help: Configure the state of LED when it is in 3 modes below

Value.label: Time set for Night light mode
Value.Help: Value1: Hour of ON. Value2: Minute of ON. Value3: Hour of OFF. Value4: Minute of OFF. E.g. The default setting is the Night light mode is enabled at 12: 00 and disabled at 8:00 0x12000800.

Value.label: Set the ON time of output load
Value.Help: Value1: 0= Disable / 1= Enable. Value2: Weekday (Bit 0-6 means Monday to Sunday). Value3: Hour of turning OFF. Value4: Minute of turning OFF E.g. The default setting 0x007F1200

Value.label: Set the OFF time of output load
Value.Help: Value1: 0= Disable / 1= Enable. Value2: Weekday (Bit 0-6 means Monday to Sunday). Value3: Hour of turning OFF. Value4: Minute of turning OFF E.g. The default setting 0x001707F00

Value.label: Set the external S1 mode
Value.Help: When the switch mode of S1 is determined or identified or configured, this mode value will not be reset after exclusion

Value.label: Set the external S2 mode
Value.Help: When the switch mode of S2 is determined or identified or configured, this mode value will not be reset after exclusion

Value.label: Control destination for S1
Value.Help: Set the control destination for external switch S1

Item.label: Control the output load itself and other nodes

Value.label: Control destination for S2
Value.Help: Set the control destination for external switch S2

Item.label: Control the output load itself and other nodes

Value.label: WallSwipe
Value.Help: Get the state of touch panel port

Value.label: S1/S2 when the Switch mode is 3-way switch
Value.Help: Set the working way for S1/S2 when the Switch mode is 3-way switch mode.

Item.label: S1 and S2 is a toggle switch
S1 and S2 are an On/Off switch

Value.label: Function of S1/S2
Value.Help: Set the function of S1/S2. Bit 0 = 0, the function of sending NIF is disabled. Bit 0 = 1, the function of sending NIF is enabled. Bit 1 = 0, the function of entering RF power level test mode is disabled. Bit 1 = 1, the function of entering RF power level test mode is enabled. Bit 2 = 0, the function of factory reset is disabled. Bit 2 = 1, the function of factory reset is enabled. Bit 3 to Bit 6 are reserved. Bit 7 = 0, the setting for Bit 0 to Bit 2 are ineffective. Bit 7 = 1, the setting for Bit 0 to Bit 2 are effective.

Value.label: Configuration factory reset function
Value.Help: Enable/disable the factory reset function of Action Button, external switches or WallSwipe.

Value.label: Configuration Locked
Value.Help: Enable/disable Configuration Locked

Value.label: Reset To Factory Defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults

Item.label: Reset to factory default setting and removed from the z-wave network

Value.label: Input 3 contact type
Value.Help: Default value 0

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system. Default value 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 second to 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Automatic turning on output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto ON disabled. 1 second to 32535 seconds Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable 3-way switch/additional switch
Value.Help: Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1 (by default). Enabling 3-way switch, dimming can be controlled by push button or switch connected to I1 and I2. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable Double click function
Value.Help: If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Item.label: Flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 5.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 second to 32767 seconds reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s).

Value.label: Minimum dimming value
Value.Help: 1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).

Value.label: Maximum dimming value
Value.Help: 2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).

Value.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
Value.Help: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through. 1- 255 = 10mseconds - 2550mseconds (2,55s), step is 10mseconds. Default value 100 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).

Value.label: Dimming time when key pressed
Value.Help: Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I1. 1- 255 = 1 second - 255 seconds. Default value 3 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 3s).

Value.label: Ignore start level
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 4. A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1. Default value 0.

Value.label: Dimming duration
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 3. The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. 32536 : offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 : value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 : value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature. Default value 32536.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. 0 : Reporting disabled. 1- 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value 5 = 0,5C change.

Group.label: Start level change/stop level change input I1
Start level change/stop level change input I1

Value.label: Mode
Value.Help: Enable selective Group Mode or Scene Mode when the Key Fob is in Use mode

Value.label: Reset configuration
Value.Help: Reset configuration set up to default setting

Value.label: Button 1 and 3 pair mode
Value.Help: In separate mode button 1 works with group A, button 3 with groups C. Click is On, Hold is dimming Up, Double click is Off, Click-Hold is dimming Down. In pair button 1/3 are Up/Down correspondingly. Click is On/Off, Hold is dimming Up/Down. Single clicks works with group A, double click with group C.

Value.label: Button 2 and 4 pair mode
Value.Help: In separate mode button 2 works with control group B, button 4 with control group D. Click is On, Hold is dimming Up, Double click is Off, Click-Hold is dimming Down. In pair button B/D are Up/Down correspondingly. Click is On/Off, Hold is dimming Up/Down. Single clicks works with group B, double click with group D.

Value.label: Command to Control Group A
Value.Help: This parameter defines the command to be sent to devices of control group A when the related button is pressed

Item.label: Switch On/Off and Dim (send Basic Set and Switch Multilevel)

Value.label: Command to Control Group B
Value.Help: This parameter defines the command to be sent to devices of control group B when the related button is pressed

Item.label: Switch On/Off and Dim (send Basic Set and Switch Multilevel)

Value.label: Command to Control Group C
Value.Help: This parameter defines the command to be sent to devices of control group C when the related button is pressed

Item.label: Switch On/Off and Dim (send Basic Set and Switch Multilevel)

Value.label: Command to Control Group D
Value.Help: This parameter defines the command to be sent to devices of control group D when the related button is pressed

Item.label: Switch On/Off and Dim (send Basic Set and Switch Multilevel)

Value.label: Send the following Switch All commands
Blocks wakeup even when wakeup interval is set
Value.Help: If the KFOB wakes up and there is no controller nearby, several unsuccessful communication attempts will drain battery

Item.label: Wakeup is possible if configured accordingly. (Default)

Value.label: Send unsolicited Battery Report on Wake Up

Item.label: To same node as wake up notification (Default)

Value.label: Operation mode
Value.Help: Set operation mode

Value.label: Sensor mode
Value.Help: Set sensor mode

Item.label: AF - Internal room sensor and floor sensor
FP - Floor sensor and power regulator

Value.label: Floor sensor type
Value.Help: Floor sensor type (10K NTC Default)

Value.label: PLo: Min power in FP-mode
Value.Help: Min power 0-9 in FP-mode (Floor sensor and power regulator mode)

Value.label: P setting
Value.Help: Power 0-10 in P-mode (Power regulator mode)

Value.label: COOL setpoint
Value.Help: Only if cooling is enabled. 50-400 (5.0C - 40.0C)

Value.label: Room sensor calibration
Value.Help: Temperature correction 0 - 4.0C (Default: 0). For positive value 40 = 4.0C. Negative value is not working (Adjust negativ calibration on thermostat)

Value.label: Floor sensor calibration
Value.Help: Temperature correction 0 - 4.0C (Default: 0). For positive value 40 = 4.0C. Negative value is not working (Adjust negativ calibration on thermostat)

Value.label: External sensor calibration
Value.Help: Temperature correction 0 - 4.0C (Default: 0). For positive value 40 = 4.0C. Negative value is not working (Adjust negativ calibration on thermostat)

Value.label: Temperature display
Value.Help: Show setpoint or calculated temperature on display(

Value.label: Temperature report interval
Value.Help: 0 (Report disabled) 1-32767 (1 - 32767 seconds)

Value.label: Meter report interval
Value.Help: 0 (Report disabled) 1-32767 (1 - 32767 seconds)

Value.label: Operation mode
Value.Help: Set operation mode

Value.label: Sensor mode
Value.Help: Set sensor mode

Item.label: AF - Internal room sensor and floor sensor
FP - Floor sensor and power regulator

Value.label: P setting
Value.Help: Power 0-10 in P-mode (Power regulator mode)

Value.Help: Only if cooling is enabled. 50-400 (5.0C - 40.0C)

Value.label: Room sensor calibration
Value.Help: Temperature correction 0 - 4.0C (Default: 0). For positive value 40 = 4.0C. Negative value is not working (Adjust negativ calibration on thermostat)

Value.Help: Temperature correction 0 - 4.0C (Default: 0). For positive value 40 = 4.0C. Negative value is not working (Adjust negativ calibration on thermostat)

Value.Help: Temperature correction 0 - 4.0C (Default: 0). For positive value 40 = 4.0C. Negative value is not working (Adjust negativ calibration on thermostat)

Value.Help: 0 (Report disabled) 1-32767 (1 - 32767 seconds)

Value.Help: 0 (Report disabled) 1-32767 (1 - 32767 seconds)

Value.label: Temperature report interval
Value.Help: 0 (Report disabled) 1-32767 (1 - 32767 seconds)

Value.label: Meter report interval
Value.Help: 0 (Report disabled) 1-32767 (1 - 32767 seconds)

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: First channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.

Value.label: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal.

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Second channel - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 2st channel controlled by the S2 switch.

Value.label: Second channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S2 terminal.

Item.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

Value.label: Second channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

Value.label: Second channel - pulse time for flashing mode
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode. 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

Value.label: Switch type
Value.Help: Inputs type configuration

Item.label: Toggle switch (contact closed - On, contact opened - OFF)
Toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status)

Value.label: Flashing mode report
Value.Help: Enabled / Disabled reports on Flashing mode

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent to specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. This parameter does not apply to 1st lifeline group. 1 - 2nd group sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group sent as secure. 4 - 4th group sent as secure. 8 - 5th group sent as secure. Default setting: 15 (all)

Value.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. 1 - Key pressed 1 time. 2 - Key pressed 2 times. 4 - Key pressed 3 times. 8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released. Default setting: 0 (none)

Value.label: S1 associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S1 Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S1 Switch Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

Value.label: S2 associations sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group. All actions are active by default. 1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch. 2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch. 4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch. 8 - ignore double click of the switch. Default setting: 0

Value.label: S2 Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.label: S2 Switch Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
Value.Help: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

Value.label: Reaction to General Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Flood Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Flood Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm frame.

Value.label: Reaction to Heat Alarm
Value.Help: This parameter determines how the device will react to Heat alarm frame.

Value.label: Flashing alarm duration
Value.Help: This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode. 1-32000 (0.1-32000s, 1s step) Default: 600 (10min)

Value.label: First channel - power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power that will result in sending new power report to the main controller. 1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

Value.label: First channel - minimal time between power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

Value.label: First channel - energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller. 1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

Value.label: Periodic power reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Periodic energy reports
Value.Help: This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

Value.label: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
Value.Help: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are being added to energy reports for first endpoint.

Value.label: Mode
Value.Help: Enable selective Group Mode or Scene Mode when the Key Fob is in Use mode

Value.label: Reset configuration
Value.Help: Reset configuration set up to default setting
